title: Bi-Weekly Movies, TV Shows, Documentaries & Podcasts Discussion Thread
selftext:
So, what is r/India watching of late?

Watched any premieres yesterday? Loved any movie that you saw recently and are dying to discuss it? Discovered any new series lately? Well, this is your space. Go crazy!

This is not just limited to Hollywood/Bollywood, nor to any particular language.

Feel free to share short films, or podcasts of your choice, too, and ask for recommendations for what to watch!

**Movies and Shows Thread is posted every two weeks on Saturday mornings |** [**Old Threads**](https://reddit.com/r/india/search?q=Movies+thread+discussion+&restrict_sr=on&sort=new&t=all)

https://preview.redd.it/e3cqi5nuw8n61.png?width=1487&format=png&auto=webp&s=c6623226acf7856bb5a61313af7bec382c8525f1
comments: took me over a month but I finally finished s01 of The Deuce last night, loved it. haven't seen a better period drama since Mad Men.

Anyone watched Batman? How is it?

EDIT: Watched it yesterday. It's okay is what I'll say.
Literally waiting for the film to start. Will let you know

The Boys: Diabolical (Animated, Prime Video)

Watching it in Indian languages and a few lines are funny af.
Saw The Batman. Unbelievably immersive experience in the theatre. Highly recommend watching on the largest and loudest screen you can find.
The new batman movie was amazing!! One of the best superhero movies ever made imo !!
Why did it take a month?
Anybody watched 'All of us are dead'? I'm not able to finish the first episode.
It was a great time. Absolutely loved it.
because i don't get time to watch much these days :(
